page.title: 17BOREHAM HOUSES M.MASKALL 1
page.content: Most of the dwellings are scattered, about the countyside. There are a number of quite attractive farm houses, several houses were once 2 or more farm workers cottages and have been modernised.There are a few medium sized houses in isolated positions and a cluster of smaller dwellings in Domsey Lane.To the South of the A.12 there is part of a residential area most of these houses having been built since 1950.There are some older buildings along the Roman Road, and a small development built in 1984. MOUNT MASKALL, Home of the Vice Lieutenent of Essex,is a grade 11 listed building situated to the North of Boreham Village,commanding fine views over the surrounding countryside.There was a house on the site in 1200,and in Tudor times there was a substantial house there.
